data.name: Bastone Brewery
data.description: Bastone first opened its doors in May of 2004. It is named and styled after the famous Belgian city (though the spelling has been simplified). This unique restaurant and brewery is housed in a 1930’s era building, the exterior of which has been restored to it’s original art deco look in association with the State of Michigan Historical Society. Inside, the high arched ceiling, wood floors and white subway wall tiles create the comfortable yet sophisticated atmosphere of a European brasserie.

data.name: Blackfriars Brewery
data.description: Opened in 2004, award winning Blackfriars Brewery brought brewing back to Great Yarmouth, Norfolk 36 years after the closure of the famous Lacons brewery

data.name: Bridge Road Brewers
data.description: At Bridge Road Brewers we constantly tweak our beers and develop new recipes to satisfy the curiosity of ourselves and our customers alike. We are not prepared to just pump out a couple of run of the mill ales or have our beer brewed under license by someone else. We prefer to create beer from scratch, using our own production equipment on our own site in our home town of Beechworth, its our passion, not a hobby or a chance to make a quick buck.

data.name: Brouwerij de Molen
data.description: Our brewery is world-famous for our large variety of (imperial) stouts, ales and smoked ales. We want to make good quality beer with respect for people and the environment.

data.name: Cape Ann Brewing Company
data.description: Visit our brew house, enjoy a pint, and take a free tour! Taste our specialty craft beers on draft and brewed on premise. Growlers and growler refills are available. Beer whose bold flavor and character reflects the spirit and courage of the sailors of the North Atlantic fishing fleet, Fisherman's is a tribute to hard work and a salute to friendships that endure. Cape Ann Brewing Co. is an award-winning, family-owned, microbrewery in the heart of downtown Gloucester on Cape Ann, Massachusetts

data.name: Cape Cod Beer
data.description:
Cape Cod Beer is about Beer. Its about brewing the best beer possible, on Cape Cod, for people who love Cape Cod. Its about having fun, and following Todd’s calling (and passion) to brew beer professionally. Its about sharing that experience with those we meet along the way that feel the same way about beer as we do.

Cape Cod Beer is Cape Cod's only microbrewery, with beer on draught in and growlers between Plymouth and Provincetown.

data.name: Flathead Lake Brewing Company
data.description: Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 on the east shore of Flathead Lake in Woods Bay, Montana and is home to handcrafted award winning beers, excellent food and spectacular views. Stop by our world class tasting room for one of our beers and sit back and enjoy the incredible mountain and lake views. It is a Montana experience to remember. Flathead Lake Brewing Co. was established in 2004 with a kitchen added in  March of 2010. FLBC endeavors to provide the highest quality product (all natural, unfiltered, and full of flavor) and customer satisfaction while supporting a responsible beer culture... “Quality Montana Lifestyle, crafted and brewed in the Flathead Valley”. The Brewery features ten premier award winning quality crafted brews as well as seasonal offerings. In addition to our focus on product quality, FLBC creates a positive experience for our customers by offering more than a great brewpub where people can come to relax and converse over great food and beer. It offers a place where people can come to learn more about the beer and the brewing process.

data.name: Foothills Brewing Company
data.description:
Foothills Brewing began in 2004 in Winston-Salem, NC, and has evolved into one of the top craft brewing operations in the southeast United States. Ranked among ratebeer.com’s 100 best breweries in the world, Foothills has garnered numerous awards for their beers, including seven Great American Beer Festival medals and three World Cup Beer medals, more than any other North Carolina-based brewery.

Foothills brews more than twenty year-round and seasonal offerings, including best sellers Hoppyum IPA and Carolina Blonde. Year-round brands also include People’s Porter, Torch Pilsner and Jade IPA; seasonals include Cottonwood Pumpkin and the highly anticipated Sexual Chocolate Imperial Stout. Foothills, Cottonwood and Carolina brands are distributed by a network of top-level distributors in North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and Washington D.C.

data.name: Fox Barrel Cider
data.description:
Fox Barrel Cider Company was founded by Sean Deorsey and Bruce Nissen in 2004. Both tired of the corporate life, in the accounting & sales arenas, Sean and Bruce decided to start their own business. Sean has been crafting ciders since his days at Santa Clara Universityand believes that "it's much better to crunch apples than to crunch numbers." Along with his wife and two young daughters, Sean resides in Auburn, California.

Bruce has worked in sales, marketing and business management roles over the past several years. He had been interested in developing an organization and had become smitten with cider since introduced to it several years ago. Along with his wife and their young son & daughter, Bruce resides in Colfax, California.

After looking throughout the Sierra Foothills, the pair chose a location in the historic railroad town of Colfax, California. The cidery originally sat in the historic Fruit Growers Exchange Association, a building that once was a storage and packing facility for the abundance of fruits grown in the area. It seemed appropriate to use this space, bringing it back towards its original use. After two years in that location, the cidery outgrew the space and moved to a much larger facility less than a mile down the road.

data.name: Great River Brewery
data.description:
Great River Brewery started in October of 2004 as a Brew Pub in Iowa City.  In December of 2008 we moved our entire brewing operation to Davenport, Iowa with hopes of starting our lifelong dream of packaging our beers.

In February 2009 we brewed our first batch of beer in our new Location.  Packaging started in May of 2010, with our 483 Pale Ale and Roller Dam Red Ale in 16 oz. cans.   Great River Brewery’s history is still being written each and every day.

data.name: Green's Brewery
data.description:
Inspired by strong European beers and developed to a closely guarded secret recipe, the specialist beers are brewed with a strong body, crisp taste and a refreshing flavour, losing none of the taste but all of the allergens.

Where as most conventional brewing practices employ either Isinglass or gelatine based products in the clearing process, Green’s only uses natural tannins, which as well as giving them an attractive hazy body, makes them suitable for both Vegetarian and Vegan diets.

Green’s beers DO NOT contain any of the following allergens or products thereof: Gluten, Crustaceans, Eggs, Fish, Peanuts, Soya beans, Milk, Lactose, Nuts, Celery, Mustard, Sesame seeds, Sulphur dioxide and sulphites.

data.name: Hargreaves Hill Brewing Company
data.description: Hargreaves Hill is proud to be one of Australia’s leading microbreweries in terms of the quality and range of beers that we make.Our mission as a company is to celebrate the brewing and enjoyment of really good beer. We brew an astonishing range of beers, from the most delicate Hefeweizen, right through to a deep, rich and intense Russian Imperial Stout.

data.name: Heinzelmännchen Brewery
data.description:
In a microbrewery in downtown Sylva, NC, German-born brewmaster Dieter Kuhn and his wife Sheryl Rudd are creating light and refreshing German beer made with wholesome grains, fresh hops & no preservatives. All beers are keg conditioned and non-filtered, making them smooth and lighter in body.
Enjoy pints or flights in our taproom then take home your favorite in one of our unique, German 2-liter growlers. We have snacks available and you are welcome to bring in food from local restaurants (some will deliver) or your picnic!

data.name: Herslev Bryghus
data.description:
Herslev Brewery is a microbrewery located on a farm with its own farm in the village Herslev near Roskilde Fjord. 

We produce hand-brewed beer without computer automation. We use instead the eyes, nose and palate, and follows the beer from day to day. The key words of our production is quality, pure ingredients and full traceability. 

We make beer, we can enjoy, and let the seasonal time inspire us in the development of new, intense flavors.

data.name: Independence Brewing Company
data.description:
Rob and Amy Cartwright embarked on their dream to brew flavorful, delicious beers for the people of Austin in October 2004. Armed with their love of beer, years of brewing experience, an intrepid spirit, and their trusty dog Jasper, they founded Independence Brewing Company.

Located in southeast Austin, amongst tech companies and warehouse park entrepreneurs, Independence Brewing is a true reflection of the creative energy and pioneering spirit that makes Austin great.

What started with a married couple and their dog, has blossomed into a crew of nineteen and a community of beer drinkers who enjoy drinking fresh, handcrafted beer.

data.name: Iron Horse Brewery
data.description:
The Iron Horse Brewery that opened its doors in December of 2004 was a bit different than today. It had a very mom and pop feel, and featured a look that was as traditional as it gets. Those who knew of it visited regularly, but the regulars were few. For many, the brewery was a thing shrouded in mystery... college students-which comprise a fair percentage of Ellensburg's population for most of the year-would occasionally see a bottle on a store shelf and ask where it came from. The likely response:

"Yeah, I think some dude makes that in his basement or something..."

The word just wasn't getting out, and things didn't look good for the tiny brewery that made exceptionally tasty ales. 
Well, a couple of hoodlums in their late-twenties jumped on the opportunity to own and operate their own brewery, and what resulted is the Iron Horse Brewery you know and love today. They tweaked some recipes, changed some names, threw some ridiculous theme parties to encourage locals to actually see the brewery with their own eyes, and good things started to happen. Locals started to dig what the guys were doing. A few bars took a chance and put Iron Horse back on tap, and the beer started flowing. 

The word started getting out.

data.name: Iron Springs Pub & Brewery
data.description: Brewpub in the heart of Marin County.

data.name: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales
data.description: Welcome to a land of open fermentation, oak barrel aging, and bottle conditioning. At Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales we are dedicated to more than the traditions of old world craftsmanship. Everything we do is designed to create ales of outstanding art and flavor. Focusing on traditional rustic country style beers brought to life through labor and love, we strive to create beers to lighten the spirit, and soothe the soul. Sharing our joy to the betterment of mankind is the most that we could hope for.

data.name: Kassik's Brewery
data.description:
Kassik's Kenai Brew Stop is housed in a small warehouse, nestled in a clearing in the woods, adjacent to the Kassik’s home in Nikiski.   Frank's passion for brewing began when his wife Debara, bought him a home brew kit for Christmas. Frank was hooked and soon became a proficient home brewer.  They built a 36 X 50 shop in hopes to someday have a brewery.  In May of 2005 Kassik's purchased a used seven barrel system, and then remodeled their building to accommodate the equipment with the help of family and friends.  The brewery opened Memorial Weekend 2006 with their first brew Beaver Tail Blonde, their Moose Point Porter was on tap a few weeks later.

Kassik’s has 8 brews on tap.  We are open 6 days a week during the winter, and daily during the summer (May - August).

data.name: Keweenaw Brewing Company
data.description: Keweenaw Brewing Company is the hops-induced vision of Dick Gray and Paul Boissevain. Dick, a Michigan Tech graduate was looking for a way to return to the Copper Country. Paul, meanwhile, was introduced to - and seduced by - the crystal clear waters of nearby Lake Superior, the beauty of the surrounding area, and the small-town charm of Houghton, Michigan. The two men, whose passion for beer runs as deep as Superior, are the driving force behind Keweenaw Brewing Company.

data.name: Landmark Brewing Co
data.description: We are a small producer of craft beers located in the Central New York city of Syracuse. We currently brew two year round beers, Landmark Vanilla Bean Brown Ale and the Landmark India Pale Ale.

data.name: Left Coast Brewing
data.description:
Left Coast Brewing Company was formed in 2004 with a capacity of 5,500 bbls.  Since then, we have expanded our operation to 13,000 bbls with our current tanks.  Our main focus for the Left Coast are Hoppy Beers, Stouts, and German Lagers. We do however add new styles as part of our seasonal program and have one Belgian tripel ale.

We brew, bottle and keg everything in house at our San Clemente facility and our team is dedicated to the perfection of our product.

data.name: Les Trois Mousquetaires
data.description: Canadian microbrewery, brewing mostly European/German style beers.

data.name: Madison River Brewing Co
data.description:
Situated in Southwestern Montana’s Gallatin Valley, Belgrade (home to Madison River Brewing Company) is an outdoorsman’s paradise.  Within an hour, one can be skiing or biking in the Bridger Mountains or Big Sky area, enjoying a hike in one of seven mountain ranges, or fishing world-class rivers.  The latter is where our name originated. 

The Madison River has earned the reputation as one of the best places to fly-fish in the world.  Because the river is located in our backyard, current Brewmaster/President, Howard McMurry chose Madison River for the name of our world-class brewery.  Sticking with the theme, most MRBC beers carry the name of a fishing fly.

Madison River Brewing Company, Inc. started in 2004 when Howard purchased the brewery and equipment from Moab Brewing.  At that time, we contract-brewed for Moab, Park City, and Big Hole breweries. In 2005, Madison River Brewing Company emerged when we received a state license to brew our own brands.

data.name: Microbrasserie Le BroueMont
data.description: Located in Bromont, the homebrewed welcomes you in a warm atmosphere of camaraderie. You can enjoy our delicious microbrews, brewed by master brewer and owner, Patrick Dunnigan. His wife and co-owner, Diane Moreau, serves one of these delicious daily or map, available seven days a week the homebrewed, is the place to stop through Bromont.

data.name: Midtfyns Bryghus
data.description: Micro brewery Midtfyns Brewery was founded in the fall of 2004, and the first beer was launched in March 2005. In the beginning  the beer was brewed under license from Scotland. When Eddie Szweda took over the management of the brewery in November 2006, he undertook radical changes for the small brewery in Brobyværk. Production was changed and a line of new and exciting beers developed by the brewery itself.

data.name: Mildura Brewing
data.description:
Producing five permanent naturally brewed beers, along with unique seasonal brews, from inside the former Astor Theatre in Mildura's restaurant precinct, the Mildura Brewery creates beers that are inspired by & named after local produce, landmarks & themes.
The unique Mildura Brewery has held on to its former glory as the Astor Theatre with a grandiose refurbishment of the magnificent art deco building, but also includes a state-of-the-art brewery that is on full display to patrons drinking or enjoying a meal in the brewery Pub. Out the back is more fermentation area & a modern bottling line capable of packaging 3000 bottles per hour

data.name: Nashoba Valley Winery
data.description:
Our brewery was established in 2004 to provide a wide range of flavorful Ales and Lagers, brewed and packaged on site at our picturesque farm. Each beer is hand crafted in small batches, employing both traditional brewing methods and American craft-brewing creativity. We offer our fine micro-brewed beers on draft with your meal at J’s Restaurant and for sale at our Wine Shoppe.

We mill our grain on site and grow hops used in our operations. All beers are 100% brewed and packaged on site. There are no additives or preservatives in our beers.

data.name: Natty Greene's Brewing Co.
data.description: Natty Greene's Pub and Brewing Company is one of the most frequented restaurants in the downtown area and in Greensboro. Natty's offers a variety of menu items such as platters, appetizers, beverages and specialty housecrafted brew on tap along with a sports bar atmosphere and patio dining available. Great restaurant for all ages. Childrens menu available.

data.name: Olde Main Brewing Co.
data.description: At Olde Main Brewing Co. we believe, it's not about the next beer, it's about enjoying the one in your hand. That's why head brewer Jeff "Puff" Irvin and brewer "Big John" Rundall blend traditional brewing practices and modern techniques to craft fresh, full-flavored beers. Taste the true deliciosity at bars, restaurant, and retail stores across Iowa or at the Ames brewery and restaurant.

data.name: Pisgah Brewing Company
data.description: Pisgah Brewing Company is located in Black Mountain, NC about 10 miles east of Asheville. We specialize in brewing hand crafted certified organic beer. Please browse around to learn about our beer, where to find it and what it means to be certified organic.

data.name: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company
data.description:
The story of Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. really starts when Fritz Rahr graduated from Texas Christian University. Fortunately for beer lovers in North Texas, Fritz not only fell in love with Fort Worth, but also fell in love with his future wife here. And in another fortuitous twist for all of us, Fritz’s wife, Erin, gave him the thumbs up when he announced that he would like to carry on the Rahr family tradition of brewing.

Fritz and Erin founded Rahr & Sons Brewing Co. in the fall of 2004. In five years, the brewery has more than doubled its brewing capacity - from 2,000 barrels per year to over 5,000 barrels per year and has won fifteen nationally-recognized awards, including a Bronze Medal at the 2008 World Beer Cup for Bucking Bock and 2009 National Grand Champion from the United States Beer Tasting Championships for Iron Thistle.

data.name: Red Hill Brewery
data.description:
Red Hill Brewery is a unique beer and food experience on the Mornington Peninsula.  Opened in 2004 by Karen and David Golding with an 800lt steam fired brewery producing 3 main beers, Golden Ale, Wheat Beer and Scotch Ale.  Seasonal Beers are producing through the year including Xmas Ale, Imperial Stout and other unique powerful chalenging beer styles.

The cafe is committed to serving real food at the Red Hill Brewery Eatery. Our food is influenced b the great beer loving nations of England, Belgium and Germany where the favorite dishes have developed over centuries according to how well they match the famous beer styles.

data.name: Red Truck Beer Company
data.description: The Red Truck Brewing Co is one of the fastest growing breweries in B.C. Red Truck Beer is a North Vancouver based operation that is focused on making and delivering the freshest beer available.

data.name: Redoak Boutique Beer Cafe
data.description: Welcome to Redoak Boutique Beer Cafe, Australia’s most awarded brewery. Here at Redoak we strive to to give you the best beer and food experience, whether it is drinking our world-class beers or enjoying beer matched with carefully prepared snacks, meals or desserts. Why? Because it is all about offering you the best taste, quality, value and service.

data.name: Rush River Brewing
data.description: Rush River Brewing Company  in River Falls, WI provides locally brewed ales throughout Wisconsin and Minnesota. Owner/Brewers Nick Anderson and Dan Chang started the company in 2004 with the help of a third partner, Robbie Stair after relocating to Minneapolis from Seattle. Robbie owned a farm in scenic Maiden Rock, WI just above the confluence of the Rush River and Lake Pepin. After converting a pole barn into a fully functioning brewery, the trio produced a limited quantity of draft-only beers while steadily building a reputation  for brewing high quality ales. After two and a half years of growth, it became evident that bottled beer was the next move to be made. Luckily, the town of River Falls, WI came to the table with an offer to build a custom building for a brand new brewery. In 2007, the new facility opened its doors with the addition of a refurbished bottling line, and additional fermenters. The new Rush River brewery was now poised to increase production and distributorship. We now have ten distributors in two states and produce nine brands including seasonals. Our small size still allows us to experiment with new styles, while the larger capacity for brewing and storage keep our regular brands flowing out the door.

data.name: Schmohz Brewing Company
data.description: Two words: cool & dark. Schmohz Ales and Lagers, like many quality craft beers, are not pasteurized. While this helps them taste fresher and more full-flavored, it also means that extended exposure to warm temperatures may cause them (especially if they are unfiltered) to taste, well, less fresh. So keep 'em cool! As for the dark part, let's just say that sunlight can negatively affect some brews (it makes 'em smell "skunky"). That's why we put our beers in light-blocking brown bottles and take extra caution to keep them out of the way of direct sunlight.
